content.text: Nostalgi2D is a TypeScript-first 2D game engine designed for building multiplayer games with an authoritative server architecture.
The engine provides a modular approach where you can opt-in to the features you need: physics, rendering, networking, and input handling.

sections.title: Installation
sections.summary: Set up CLI, templates, and your first project.

content.text: Getting started with Nostalgi2D is straightforward. Follow these steps to set up your development environment.

content.code:
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/madebykrol/Nostalgi2DTs

# Install dependencies
npm install

# Start development server
npm run dev

sections.title: Engine Core
sections.summary: Game loop, timing, ECS, scenes, and input.

content.text: The engine core provides the fundamental building blocks for your game.
Nostalgi2D uses a fixed timestep game loop for deterministic simulation. This ensures consistent behavior across different machines and frame rates.
The ECS architecture separates data (components) from behavior (systems), making your game logic modular and maintainable.
Nostalgi2D provides built-in networking capabilities for multiplayer games.
The server has full control over the game state, preventing cheating and ensuring fair gameplay.
Client-side prediction provides immediate feedback to players while maintaining server authority.

sections.title: Rendering
sections.summary: Adapters for Pixi, Canvas2D, and Three.js.

content.text: Nostalgi2D supports multiple rendering backends, allowing you to choose the best fit for your game.
